poem:
Title: The Capitol's Symphony

In the Capitol's heart
where power dances with deceit,
a strident trumpet grows.
In layers of fall's chill,
Republican leaves gather,
hosting a November spectacle.
Hunter's story, a wave undecided,
swells beneath the White House's gaze,
the dance of pardons yet unwritten.
United or apart, 
the rhythmic hum of resistance
echoes in the trumpeter's song.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "White House won’t rule out commuting Hunter Biden sentence – live 6.59pm BST Donald Trump is expected to meet with congressional Republicans in Washington DC this, as the GOP tries to present a united front ahead of the November elections. Trump is scheduled on Thursday to meet with House Republicans at the Capitol Hill club, and then with Republican senators in the afternoon at the National Republican Senatorial Committee headquarters, according to reports. Mike Johnson,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: White House won’t rule out commuting Hunter Biden sentence – live 6.59pm BST Donald Trump is expected to meet with congressional Republicans in Washington DC this, as the GOP tries to present a united front ahead of the November elections. Trump is scheduled on Thursday to meet with House Republicans at the Capitol Hill club, and then with Republican senators in the afternoon at the National Republican Senatorial Committee headquarters, according to reports. Mike Johnson,
